snippet: Two members of the ethnic minority were sentenced to death and three others were given prison sentences for what a court called a “terror attack” that killed 15 people.
abstract: Court in Xinjiang region in China sentences two members of Uighur ethnic minority to death and gives prison sentences to three others for what authorities call 'terror attack' that killed 15 people; convictions appear to be part of drive by Chinese government to reinforce control in restive western China after succession of deadly confrontations between authorities and members of Uighur population.
lead_paragraph: Two members of the ethnic minority were sentenced to death and three others were given prison sentences for what a court called a “terror attack” that killed 15 people.

headline.main: 5 Uighurs Sentenced in China for Attack
headline.print_headline: 5 Uighurs Sentenced In China For Attack
